padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1875701">sstrawberyskyy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-07">05/07/24 03:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is what I wanted from Diptyque's Eau Duelle! Yes! Stunning. Such a gorgeous vanilla with incense, would be a perfect winter fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2148256"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2148256#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2146874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2146874" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bicr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1728700"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1728700.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bicr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rirana-Parfume/Tonka-Nutmeg-67083.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67083.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tonka Nutmeg"title="Tonka Nutmeg"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2146874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2146874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1728700">Bicr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-05">05/05/24 17:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Perfection,,,</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2146874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2146874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2120486" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2120486" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coffeeandscents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383663"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1383663.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coffeeandscents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Celine/Black-Tie-57925.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57925.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Tie"title="Black Tie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2120486ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2120486" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383663">Coffeeandscents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so excited to try this, I received a sample and it was an immediate no for me. It had that musty old man smell. I don’t know how else to describe it. If you’re looking for a sweet amber vanilla this is not it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2120486"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2120486#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2100046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2100046" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Douggie T-Ray"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1907000"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1907000.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Douggie T-Ray" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Oud-Wood-1826.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1826.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Wood"title="Oud Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2100046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2100046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1907000">Douggie T-Ray</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-21">03/21/24 17:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is a weird camphor note in the opening which mostly goes away after the first 10 minutes or so, but hangs around in the background during the first hour. It’s quite sharp and unexpected and overpowers the incense initially. I love smoky scents and have been testing a lot out recently, but in this one the incense is not really that smoky after the opening - more like the scent of the dust and ashes left over by the incense after its burned down. Its very powdery and the vanilla is prominent. Its like a dance between the vanilla and incense twirling about each other, competing for prominence. The lack of a deeper, woody smokiness means that, for me, I would not invest in a full bottle. The fragrance is very unisex, skewing perhaps a little more to the feminine side. I applied 4 spritzes from a Penhaligons tester vial to my neck at 11am. It projected moderately until around 4, with some good presence. Then it started to die away. However it is now 8.30 and I can still smell it projecting softly. That would have to make it one of the better performing selections in Penhaligon’s Portraits series.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2100046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2100046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097892" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097892" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellGood_Chi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1999067"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellGood_Chi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/TriBeCa-59904.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59904.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="TriBeCa"title="TriBeCa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097892ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097892" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1999067">SmellGood_Chi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 20:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a large decant of this and finally getting around to trying it. It's lovely! Warm vanilla incense and ambrette. The grapefruit makes it really unique. It's living somewhere between the intersection of niche and gourmand. Moderately complex as vanillas go. I felt like I smelled quite delicious and lickable wearing it -- for about three hours. I touched up twice during the day while wearing it. I don't know that it's worth the cost of a full bottle but I'm glad I got to try this one from Penhaligon. The full bottle is lovely. The juice itself is a pretty reddish brown. It's demi-sec enough to be unisex. I definitely think this would smell as good on a man as it does on me but, again, I'm not sure I'd be willing to foot the (hefty) bill for a full bottle of this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2097892"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2097892#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2079064" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2079064" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="doodoomizer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1957490"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="doodoomizer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Angels-Share-62615.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62615.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angels' Share"title="Angels' Share"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2079064ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2079064" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1957490">doodoomizer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 10:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely adore the smell of it, a gorgeous and elegant vanilla scent. It just does not perform well, especially considering it's price</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2079064"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2079064#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2075551" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2075551" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OudyHarrelson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1939647"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="OudyHarrelson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Don-26709.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26709.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Don"title="Don"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2075551ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2075551" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1939647">OudyHarrelson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-27">02/27/24 05:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I literally can’t smell anything on it. Tried it 3 times so far, and the only way I even catch a whiff of what it is is when I shove my nose into a tester. I really want to like it because the Flacon is so cool, but I really can’t justify 250 bucks for a beautiful bottle of water</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2075551"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2075551#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073187" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AryanasPerfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AryanasPerfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/I-Don-t-Need-A-Prince-By-My-Side-To-Be-A-Princess-50497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"title="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539">AryanasPerfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 20:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Burnt wood , like the smoke from burnt wood and then it turns into a dilluted version of Babycat. Huge dissapointment! Whoever says this smells like Eau Duelle, go get your noses checked! where do you smell the smoke in Eau Duelle? Eau Duelle has smokiness from cypriol not actual smoke. The dragon here smells like you burn wood and inhale the smoke, extremly off putting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2073187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2073187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072200" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072200" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="muskymammal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1969735"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="muskymammal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072200ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072200" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1969735">muskymammal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-23">02/23/24 22:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fragrance that has a lot of potential but disappoints me a little. I like it but I don't love it as I believe it is missing something. It is purely vanilla and incense. In my opinion, not worth it for the price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2072200"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2072200#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2058930" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2058930" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CynicalPink"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924789"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1924789.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CynicalPink" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Book-50618.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50618.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Book"title="Book"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2058930ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2058930" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924789">CynicalPink</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 06:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pulled a tiny bit of incense in the first twenty minutes or so and then moved to a sweet, pleasant vanilla. But that's it. I didn't get any additional notes, and it lasted about two hours on my skin (and from the get-go, I had to nearly press my nose to my wrist to smell it). Liberally sprayed my sweater, too, with my sampler, and at a party three hours later, when I asked friends, they said they couldn't tell I was wearing anything.<br />
<br />
So... a safe scent for vanilla lovers, and the bottle is kind of fun, but the performance is so poor that I don't think I could justify  buying a full bottle, even if it were discounted.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2058930"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2058930#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2025482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2025482" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RoGo72"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1634125"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RoGo72" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2025482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2025482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1634125">RoGo72</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-09">01/09/24 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My first Penhaligons purchase, I was initially attracted to The World According to Arthur when I read the notes. I love incense but understand how it can be overpowering (if you’re Catholic think about the incense used during Mass &amp; how it can sometimes choke you out)! This fragrance opens incredibly smokey, but it really doesn’t smell like something is on fire. I personally don’t like smelling like a burning building 😀 Soon after that initial blast the beautiful amber, vanilla, &amp; sage notes kick in &amp; Arthur stays linear afterward. Overall, it’s a magnificent cold weather scent, but it just doesn’t last very long which is unfortunate. To solve that problem, I always make sure I have a travel atomizer in my purse so I can reapply throughout the day. Spraying clothing also helps as does using an unscented moisturizer on skin beforehand. Yes, it is very similar to Eau Duelle EDP. I have both mainly because I love the scent profile, but if you already have ED then you really don’t need Arthur. ED is also less expensive although I never pay full retail price when purchasing any fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2025482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2025482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2010235" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2010235" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="monamushroom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1539708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="monamushroom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Room-1015/Sonic-Flower-80011.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80011.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sonic Flower"title="Sonic Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2010235ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2010235" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539708">monamushroom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-25">12/25/23 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smoke note is loooovely, almost woody, but still sweet. It smells a bit like the potpourri you burn at christmas, but I guess that is the triple incence :-) The vanilla compliments the smokiness nicely, and it feels very well blended.<br />
<br />
It is fresh off the bottle, but I don’t get any freshness on my skin as it dries down to something warm and sweet. It gets more and more female after a while, but it stays smoky and mysterious. It lasts for a while but it is pretty intimate.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2010235"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2010235#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1993321" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993321" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WeezyPipes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1764595"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1764595.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WeezyPipes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993321ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993321" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1764595">WeezyPipes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 14:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just get vanilla, white chocolate, cake frosting...to me it's very one-dimensional and feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1993321"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1993321#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966871" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966871" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maliken"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1598503.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maliken" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966871ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966871" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598503">Maliken</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 11:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get the Eau Duelle comparisons and might even give the nod to The World According to Arthur when it comes to scent alone. Most of Penhaligon's Portraits have lackluster performance and this one ranks towards the bottom right alongside Changing Constance. I've seen this fragrance discounted at my local niche perfumer -40% off and still think it's overpriced purely because of how bad it performs. It withers to a skin scent within 30 minutes and it's pretty much gone completely in 4 hours. Of course quality of the scent should be a priority, but there are citrus colognes that perform better than this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1966871"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1966871#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1955574" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1955574" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanaC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.75237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanaC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1955574ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1955574" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237">tanaC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 21:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The World According to Arthur Penhaligon's<br />
(USD 100, 75ml. used bottle no box, 204513)<br />
<br />
First Impression,<br />
I know the word "Oriental" are very not a good to describe the fragrance in 2020 as it looks racist.<br />
But, for Both The World According to Arthur (for short: TWATA) and The Uncompromising Sohan (for short: TUS) <br />
might only be my expectation to describe this as Oriental.<br />
<br />
Being, both perfume are very Oriental to the eye of westerner.<br />
I love the fact being that TWATA, using story of traveling far away from the origins (in this case; England).<br />
<br />
TWATA is heavy incense vanillin amber that not barely any sweetness in.<br />
But this is slightly sweeten to the certain level that I think is enough to put in range of "non-sweeten vanilla"<br />
This one still keep it mystical because of cloud of Incense.<br />
But something firey is underneath; like a dragon's breath.<br />
<br />
I personally like this more than Eau Duelle, even the opening is similar.<br />
But Eau Duelle is more etiquette while this one is like Educate but a bit rebilling.  <br />
<br />
At the price I get, I think it yeah - why not?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1955574"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1955574#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1947514" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1947514" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lykopa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492443"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1492443.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lykopa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-di-Parma-Blu-Mediterraneo-Fico-di-Amalfi-1687.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1687.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"title="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1947514ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1947514" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492443">Lykopa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-08">10/08/23 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, smoky, sexy, with a strong sage note. I love the tonka bean in here. This is much more masculine leaning, but I enjoy its complexity. Not usually a scent profile I gravitate towards, but it drew me in for some reason.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1947514"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1947514#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1925401" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1925401" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Clairexoxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617341"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1617341.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Clairexoxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1925401ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1925401" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); Unisex. Very pleasant. but It’s very soft and quiet so the performance is a big let down. Overall it’s meh because of the performance but I really like the scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1925401"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1925401#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1908492" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908492" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AhmedElbahja95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1793463.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AhmedElbahja95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908492ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908492" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793463">AhmedElbahja95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-22">08/22/23 06:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The perfume itself is very nice, but it falls massively on it's face in the performance department. I love Arthur by Penhaligon's, but I wouldn't buy it again. Only because I feel it's too expensive for the lack of performance. I give this 7/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1908492"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1908492#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1884605" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1884605" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lord Lucan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1532517.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lord Lucan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Marylebone-Wood-49654.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49654.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marylebone Wood"title="Marylebone Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1884605ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1884605" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532517">Lord Lucan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-22">07/22/23 12:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It seems my search for a vanilla and powdery scent continues. I was sure this would be the one after all that it would hold the other of you who were pointing to. Instead what do you get from this is a very strong smokey and musky scent. <br />
If anyone can recommend a vanilla and powdery scent for men, similar to that of Empressa by Penhaligan then please do let me know.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1884605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1884605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1878967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1878967" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cyclone1391"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666114"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.666114.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cyclone1391" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1878967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1878967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666114">cyclone1391</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-14">07/14/23 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Something very musty in the opening on my skin. Perhaps it's the incense but it's more ash than incense IMO. Then turns to a play doh type of vanilla which does very much remind me of Diptyque Eau Duelle which I do not care for either. Gorgeous bottle but it's a pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1878967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1878967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1876279" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1876279" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LauraVTerrazas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1404949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LauraVTerrazas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rihla-Eau-de-Parfum-66765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rihla Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Rihla Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1876279ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1876279" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949">LauraVTerrazas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-11">07/11/23 10:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is gorgeous but I think it would be a little redundant if I were to purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1876279"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1876279#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1872025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1872025" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vexel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/471621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.471621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vexel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Confessions-of-A-Rebel/Bitch-Please-67379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bitch, Please"title="Bitch, Please"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1872025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1872025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/471621">Vexel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-05">07/05/23 15:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is designed, I think, for blotter appeal. An ultimately limpid brew on the skin, unacceptably so for this reviewer. Too muted. In the past I would have said if the mood of this scent inspires something in you invest in a sample of Spiritueuse Double Vanille instead, though there's evidence it's been hit with the reformulation hammer... YMMV<br />
<br />
L'Occitane's Eau des Baux is another thought that comes to mind at a far more reasonable price point. I'd sample either of these two before I gave the time of day to Arthur.<br />
<br />
It's not as if I think this smells bad or anything like that, and of course everyone is going to have their unique take influenced in part by their frame of reference. That said I can't imagine a world where I would buy this when the above fragrances exist. To each their own.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1872025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1872025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1812760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1812760" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Luke.Swan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1628416"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1628416.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Luke.Swan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1812760ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1812760" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1628416">Luke.Swan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-19">04/19/23 12:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just recently got into this house and Arthur was my first pick. I ended up buying a high partial and i'm not disappointed in the slightest. It's a beautiful fragrance with a huge dose of incense, vanilla, and musk. It's a linear scent as I don't get much development throughout. It's a super high quality fragrance. It's worth 200+ for me but probably not others. <br />
<br />
The longevity is great at around 8-9 hours on my skin but the projection is poor. Very light projection which I personally like because I needed a lighter, office safe, inoffensive winter fragrance. IMO it's the best portraits bottle by miles. I find it a full unisex fragrance. A must smell if you're a fan of incense. <br />
<br />
Smell 10/10 <br />
Performance (5/10)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1812760"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1812760#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1806171" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1806171" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysticalArugula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysticalArugula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1806171ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1806171" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303">MysticalArugula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-11">04/11/23 10:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Probably one of the most disappointing fragrances from Penhaligon's😭 It just smells like a lack luster vanilla that's so weak. I don't think there's anything special about it except for the bottle. I really wanted to love this fragrance but it's not worth it. Get the Naxos by Xerjoff for that price- now that's a vanilla worth spending. You are only paying for the bottle. Thank goodness I saved myself from a blind buy🙏🙏🙏<br />
<br />
No Zodiac Trio for this one, not worth it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1806171"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1806171#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1797645" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1585761">chopins_bolognese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-31">03/31/23 23:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells great in the bottle, and had an incredible opening. My impression was completely changed after just a few minutes of wearing. I did not like how this one developed. The smoky note is beautiful, but there is a play-doh element to this that I don't like it at all. If the tonka and vanilla were downplayed and the smoke/incense were more prominent, I would like this a lot more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1797645"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1797645#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1778053" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
