padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406062">gbvfx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-22">02/22/22 02:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Penhaligon's and it pains me to say this is a massive let down. I'm struggling to smell anything after spraying, but what I do get is germolene mixed with vanilla and a hint of smokiness. I had a sample of halfeti delivered the same time which is a masterpiece, comparing the two is night and day in terms of smell and longevity</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1884605" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lord Lucan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1532517.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lord Lucan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Marylebone-Wood-49654.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49654.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marylebone Wood"title="Marylebone Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1884605ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1884605" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532517">Lord Lucan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-22">07/22/23 12:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It seems my search for a vanilla and powdery scent continues. I was sure this would be the one after all that it would hold the other of you who were pointing to. Instead what do you get from this is a very strong smokey and musky scent. <br />
If anyone can recommend a vanilla and powdery scent for men, similar to that of Empressa by Penhaligan then please do let me know.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="1884605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=1884605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2175628" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175628" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Turtle2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1962244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Turtle2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Halfeti-Leather-61523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Halfeti Leather"title="Halfeti Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175628ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175628" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244">Turtle2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-02">06/02/24 09:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Despite being labeled a vanilla amber I'm getting almost camphorwood dare i say medicinal notes from the incense. Rather intimate if you don't douse yourself in it but nothing really wowing because its so mellow unless you're into that. Arthur is one of the more elderly scents befitting being Lord George's brother but with none of the gravitas, its daedalic in all the wrong places. Honestly the best thing about it is the dragon head flacon and the juice color. Penhaligon's should have retired Arthur instead of Roaring Radcliffe. I'll give it a second chance as I burn through the sample but I'm not expecting a big change in opinion like I had with Al-Ula.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="71646"comment_id="2175628"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-World-According-to-Arthur-71646.html?ccid=2175628#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="71646" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="71646":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="71646" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>
</div></div></div>
            </div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
